meanings.definition: Pledged as security without transferring possession.
meanings.sent1: The hypothecated car was left in the garage as collateral.
meanings.sent2: The bank accepted the hypothecated property as security for the loan.
meanings.sent3: The hypothecated jewelry was so safe, even the burglars couldn't touch it!
meanings.sent4: Her trust in him was as hypothecated as a locked treasure chest.
meanings.sent5: The hypothecated document was as secure as a fortress.

meanings.sent1: He hypothecated his savings account to secure the loan.
meanings.sent2: She hypothecated her jewelry to borrow money for the business.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel hypothecated its acorns to ensure a plentiful winter.
meanings.sent4: The captain hypothecated his ship to fund the expedition.
meanings.sent5: They hypothecated their future earnings to buy their dream home.
